Team Members

Team target

Our team aims to design and build a user-friendly interface for the website. Our work covers desiging UI, refactoring web page, gathering feedback and improve the pages.


What is a good UI?

According to us, a good UI design can give customers good experience when go through the website. It must be easy for customers among all levels(age, intellegence and etc.) to use and allow user to access information desired as fast as possible. Users should be able to access any page in this website from whichever page they are. Also, the interface style should be consistent across all pages to strive for smoothest transition when user walk across our web pages. Also the style should be adapted to most users' comfort that font, background and other elements won't cause negative feeling of customers. We have gather some guide and documentation for UI design:

  • Principles of User Interface Design
  • 5 aspects of a good user interface
  • 8 Characteristics Of Successful User Interfaces
  • What makes a good user interface?


Design V1.0

Design

For the first version, we want to clear up the web with a more organized UI. To achive the standard UI standard, we first think about adding a navigation bar that allow users to access all links any where. So after several argument and result comparison, we choose the collapsible side bar for the following reason.

1. Leave most effective area for content.
2. Easy for user to access other links from wherever they are.


Deployment

We are working on a effective plan on refactoring the websites with our stylesheet. And we want it to minimize the impact to others' work and make it more flexible for future update. So we are thinking make a header file that include all common elements such as stylesheet, js function and navigation bar. In this way, we could replace all repeat elements by some include syntax. Even if UI style changes in future, this could minimize the workload.
